subject: Politics
title: Civil Disobedience
description: A fast breakdown of Civil Disobedience for builders.

hook.text: Rosa Parks broke the law by sitting in a bus seat. Sometimes breaking the law is the most moral thing to do.

buildup.text: Civil disobedience means deliberately breaking unjust laws to provoke change, while accepting the legal consequences.

discovery.text: Thoreau coined the term in 1849. Gandhi and King transformed it into a global strategy for justice.

twist.text: Civil disobedience requires nonviolence and accepting punishment. Without those, it becomes mere lawbreaking.

climax.text: From suffragettes to climate activists, civil disobedience remains the conscience of democracy.

punchline.text: Unjust laws demand defiance. Civil disobedience is democracy correcting itself.

quiz.question: What distinguishes civil disobedience from ordinary lawbreaking?
options: It is nonviolent and the protester accepts legal consequences
It involves using violence to overthrow the government
It is done secretly to avoid any punishment
